programme.title: Free Spirit
programme.sub-title: Free Spirit : How Louisville is Blazing a New Bourbon Trail
programme.desc: Kate learns how to play a Germantown street game, gets up close and personal with handcrafted, hand-charred bourbon barrels, and learns to fall back in love with whiskey – and natural wine.

programme.title: Ed & Day in The 'Burgh
programme.sub-title: Ed and Day in the ‘Burgh: Rebuilding in Braddock
programme.desc: Ed and Day tour Day's hometown neighborhood and make delicious sweet potato pies before touring the expansive Brew Gentleman brewery in Braddock.

programme.title: Only In
programme.sub-title: Only In: Homemade CEOs, Recycle Bicycle & Pennsyltucky Whiskey in Harrisburg, PA
programme.desc: Where can you find young entrepreneurs, a nonprofit tune-up shop keeping the community safe and a distillery serving up the spirit of Central Pennsylvania? The same place where genius is grown and savory ice cream is a tradition.

programme.title: Blind Kitchen
programme.desc: Chef Michael Ferrazzani, creator of Ya Mamma’s sauce, challenges the North End born Italian stallion, Chef Kenny Palazzolo, to a true neighborhood duel. Can Michael’s Grandma inspired dish bring down the chef who lives, laughs and cooks Italian?

programme.title: Plate It!
programme.sub-title: Plate It, Pittsburgh!: Catch of the Day
programme.desc: Chefs Nate Schoedel and Ivan Gil-Silva are casting their nets for the best Catch of the Day dishes in today's seafood showdown. Can our chefs reel in a victory? Or will they let the big one get away?

programme.title: Hometown Tragedy
programme.desc: A teen murdered but no suspects. A woman allegedly killed by a panhandler

programme.title: Hometown Tragedy
programme.sub-title: Hometown Tragedy: Highway of Horrors: The Shotgun Slayer Manhunt
programme.desc: In 1977, people across Pittsburgh live in fear as a string of brutal killings sends detectives on a chase to catch the shotgun slayer. He invades homes and senselessly attacks with a shotgun, knives and hammers in the dead of night.

programme.title: Stitch
programme.desc: Short stories show how to appreciate the amazing world around us.

programme.title: Crimes, Cons & Capers
programme.sub-title: Crimes, Cons and Capers: Huge Evidence Hauls Seen on the Force
programme.desc: Whether it’s gathering thousands of mysterious, colorful packets stuffed in a store’s ceiling or valuable wildlife slithering to freedom, investigators must be ready to decisively face a range of mammoth tasks in the field.

programme.title: Maker Nation Challenge
programme.sub-title: Maker Nation Challenge: Designers Wow Judges with Mardi Gras Marvels
programme.desc: Costumes are a part of the fabric that makes up New Orleans. As three local designers will find out – nothing is easy in the Big Easy as they compete in creating one-of-a-kind costumes inspired by the Crescent City and the river that shapes it.

programme.title: Maker Nation
programme.desc: Mardi Gras beading in New Orleans and a paper-folding artist in Austin.

programme.title: Blind Kitchen
programme.sub-title: Blind Kitchen: Re-creating Southern Comfort Classic vs. Elevated American Fusion
programme.desc: It’s a culinary battle of the senses between two iconic chefs in the City Beautiful. Watch as Chef Liz of Garp & Fuss in Winter Park takes on Chef Trina of Se7en Bites in The Milk District. It’s The Knife versus The Whisk!

programme.title: Eat Play Stay
programme.sub-title: Eat Play Stay: Tap into Fun in New Glarus, WI
programme.desc: Drink a local beer as you browse antiques and oddities. Donate to a good cause by sticking a dollar bill in the ceiling at a popular tavern, and get your recommended eight to fourteen hours of sleep in a vintage camper.

programme.title: Ed & Day in The 'Burgh
programme.sub-title: Ed and Day in the ‘Burgh: Hanging Out in Homewood
programme.desc: Ed and Day travel to Homewood to see if they have what it takes to be urban beekeepers, elite barbers, and African dancers and drummers.

programme.title: Heroes On Call
programme.sub-title: Heroes On Call: The Forgotten Story of America's First Paramedics
programme.desc: In the 1960s, Americans were dying at shocking rates due to inadequate emergency care. Enter Freedom House Ambulance Service: the first paramedics unit in the U.S., run and staffed by Black men and women. This is the origin story of EMS.

programme.title: Ballin' in Baltimore
programme.sub-title: Ballin' in Baltimore: Activist Nyki Robinson Intros Angel to Baltimore's Most Impactful Changemakers
programme.desc: Angel partners with Black Girls Vote founder, Nyki Robinson, to celebrate Baltimore's brightest Black changemakers. They spotlight a mission-driven clothing brand, a celebrated restaurant, powerful art and an incredible urban farm.

programme.title: Show Me Milwaukee
programme.sub-title: Show Me Milwaukee : Laughs on Tap, Fuel Café & a Secret Agent Pub
programme.desc: Greg meets up with Milwaukee Comedy Festival co-founder, Matt Kemple, for an unforgettable night in the life of a comedian. Greg hosts his first comedy show, elevates late night brunch and tests out his improv skills after a grand secret entrance.

programme.title: Plate It!
programme.desc: Seafood starter, seafood main, seafood…dessert? Chef Janine Villalobos and Chef Aziz Bellarbi-Sala push the limits of fish-forward dining to try to ""catch"" the judges’ favor.

programme.title: Finding Adventure
programme.sub-title: Finding Adventure: Finally Free to Be Me
programme.desc: After transitioning and battling cancer, Madison Wilkins finally feels comfortable in her own skin. Kinga goes to Orlando, Florida to help Madison let her hair down and experience adventure as the woman she’s always longed to be.

programme.title: Hometown Tragedy
programme.sub-title: Hometown Tragedy: The 50,000-Hour Search for a Missing Teen
programme.desc: Sierra Lamar leaves for school one morning and vanishes with barely a trace, setting in motion one of the largest searches in U.S. history. The community and investigators still have unanswered questions.

programme.title: Only In
programme.sub-title: Only In: Homemade CEOs, Recycle Bicycle & Pennsyltucky Whiskey in Harrisburg, PA
programme.desc: Where can you find young entrepreneurs, a nonprofit tune-up shop keeping the community safe and a distillery serving up the spirit of Central Pennsylvania? The same place where genius is grown and savory ice cream is a tradition.

programme.title: WGAL Local News
programme.desc: Get the latest local news and weather from WGAL.

programme.title: Game Gone Wild: The Socker Slam Story
programme.sub-title: Game Gone Wild: The Socker Slam Story
programme.desc: A stranger than fiction documentary that chronicles a semi-scripted extreme sporting league that premiered in 2000. Socker Slam took elements of wrestling, rugby and “butts up” shenanigans and body slammed them into a soccer drama.

programme.title: Stitch
programme.desc: Stitch showcases the feel-good and do-good that make up the fabric of America from inspiring tales of perseverance, to good Samaritans helping neighbors, to trailblazers improving their communities.

programme.title: Ed & Day in The 'Burgh
programme.desc: Comedians, podcasters and craft beer enthusiasts Ed Bailey and Day Bracey explore hot spots, hidden gems and the best places to grab a cold brew in the 'Burgh.

programme.title: Americas Most Delish
programme.sub-title: America's Most Delish Midwest: 10 Remix Dishes to Savor from the Midwest
programme.desc: Discover where classic dishes collide to create delightful flavors. From pizza debates to the Juicy Lucy to a good old-fashioned red beer, see how regional creativity transforms beloved foods into something more.

programme.title: My Perfect Day
programme.sub-title: My Perfect Day with Woman's Day: Caring Crusader Enjoys Paw-tastic Surprises at Every Turn
programme.desc: Scott's life revolves around everyone's favorite four-legged friends, from rescuing and caring for countless dogs, his spirit is unwavering. Today Meaghan gives back a day full of moments for him and his beloved canine companion.

programme.title: Chaos & Kindness
programme.sub-title: Chaos & Kindness: Running on Empty & Finishing with Family
programme.desc: Justin pushes body and mind through seven brutal marathons on seven continents in seven days. From frostbite in Antarctica to his daughter joining him for the final steps in Miami, this is the most intense and inspiring challenge of his life.

programme.title: Plate It!
programme.desc: Watch things heat up in the kitchen as two local chefs go head-to-head to create a three-course meal utilizing ingredients sourced from one of the city’s unique marketplaces.

programme.title: Eat Play Stay
programme.desc: Experience serious vacation vibes and discover some of the most special corners of America on this guided tour of must-visit cities.

programme.title: What's On The Menu?
programme.desc: What's On The Menu?

programme.title: Matter of Fact
programme.desc: This year, we're marking ten seasons as a show. Our goal has been to highlight you, Americans from across the country. Stories that mirrored our shared challenges are perseverance, ingenuity and compassion. Today, we take a look at some of those.

programme.title: Searching for Johnny
programme.desc: (2022) The disappearance of Johnny Gosch is one of Iowa's longest running, and most notorious mysteries. In 1982, the 12-year-old paperboy in West Des Moines vanished without a trace. Forty years later, KCCI uncovers where the investigation stands.

programme.title: On The Job
programme.desc: Orlando expert, Brendan O'Connor, celebrates the people behind the scenes of the businesses that make Orlando a truly unique place. Join him as he rolls up his sleeves and receives hands on training while spending a day with them, On The Job.

programme.title: Finding Adventure
programme.desc: Embark on amazing adventures across America with host Kinga Philipps who takes locals out of their comfort zones to experience transformation in the great outdoors.

programme.title: Unbelievable
programme.desc: Brace yourself for heart-stopping heroics as rescuers leap into action! A semi-truck teeters dangerously over the Ohio River, a devastating gas explosion reduces homes to rubble, and a capsized cargo ship leaves its crew fighting for survival.

programme.title: Hit Me With Your Best Spot
programme.desc: No one knows a city like the locals who live there. This series taps into the insider knowledge of notable figures including musicians, athletes, chefs, artists, influencers, and others who share their best spots to hit up in the city.

programme.title: Local Love
programme.desc: One local single experiences some of the best their city has to offer on three blind dates. Our singles may spend three perfect days out on the town, but there can only be one love match. Who will be picked for a second date?

programme.title: Hometown Tragedy
programme.desc: A true crime series telling the story of unfathomable crimes that have rocked American communities leaving them forever changed.

programme.title: Always Remember Your Name
programme.desc: A documentary of mistaken identity, hope, love, and the power of story by two Holocaust survivors.

programme.title: Chronicle: Bring Them Home
programme.desc: (2017) Taken from their reservations, thousands of Native American children underwent an education experiment at the Carlisle Indian Industrial School. WGAL News 8's Matt Barcaro documents the Northern Arapaho's historic attempt to reclaim loved ones.

programme.title: Lowrider Legacy
programme.sub-title: Lowrider Legacy: A History of Resistance on Wheels
programme.desc: Lowrider Legacy follows celebrated lowrider families, scholars, and activists and documents the history of resistance on wheels that has defined lowrider culture.

programme.title: Crimes, Cons & Capers
programme.desc: Crimes, Cons & Capers explores some of the wildest headline-grabbing crimes and far-fetched escapades from across the country including bizarre love scams, high-speed car chases, risky prison breaks and more.
